stem: The charging nurse is reviewing new medical orders for three agitated clients. Based on the documentation in the Clinical Order Verification Log and the hospital's legal standards, match each order with its appropriate fulfillment status.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient A: 22y/o male with psychotic mania; currently violent. Order received for 4-point leather restraints. 
Patient B: 78y/o female with delirium; pulling at a central line. Order received for soft wrist restraints. 
Patient C: 45y/o male, post-operative, occasionally confused. No current agitation.

tabs.title: Clinical Order Verification Log
tabs.content:
PatientOrder ContentRestraint TypeVerification Status
A'Restraints for 12 hours due to violence'LeatherMissing Renew Frequency
B'Soft wrist restraints for line protection; renew every 24h'Soft WristComplete
C'Soft restraints PRN if patient becomes agitated'NoneIllegal Order Type

tabs.title: Restraint Order Policy
tabs.content:
1. NO PRN (As needed) orders allowed. 
2. Must specify: Reason, Type, Location, and Duration. 
3. Behavioral orders (Violence) max duration: 4 hours. 
4. Medical orders (Line protection) max duration: 24 hours.

rows.text: An order for 'Behavioral restraints' for 8 hours without renewal
An order specifies 'Soft wrist restraints to prevent line pulling' for 24 hours
Applying restraints first in an emergency, then obtaining a verbal order within 15 minutes

rationale.correct: Valid actions (c1) include specific medical restraint orders for 24 hours (r3) and applying restraints in a life-threatening emergency before getting the order (r4). Invalid actions (c2) include PRN orders (r1) and behavioral orders longer than 4 hours (r2 is 8 hours).
clinicalPearls: In an emergency, safety comes FIRST, paperwork second. You can apply the restraint and then call the MD.
Wait, you never use restraints because a patient is 'annoying' or you are 'short-staffed'.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking all restraints need renewal every 4 hours.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Differentiate by REASON. If the reason is pulling a tube (Medical), it's 24 hours. If the reason is hitting a nurse (Behavioral), it's 4 hours.
